  The RAPID (Rapid Ascertainment Process 
for Institutional Deaths) method, which 
was developed by Immpact, a global 
research initiative. The RAPID method 
identifies unreported maternal deaths in 
health facilities by reviewing all facility 
records relating to deaths among women of 
reproductive age (aged 15 – 49 years),  and 
then identifying those that are pregnancy-
related (Immpact, 2007). This approach 
minimizes the under
